column4: in precise I get Package biber is not available, but is referred to by another package. . Is this a bug?
yep
ubuntu is not what it used to be
I don't think they fix bugs any more
Hmm, wut.
have you ever reported a bug that was fixed?
Several times.
can you give one example in the last 2 years?
Sure, https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1068921 was fixed a few days ago.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/930962 recently got a workaround.
It affected me, and I got a fix. So please don't talk nonsense about not fixing bugs.
a) I am impressed you got things fixed and b) it's not nonsense
I have reported a lot of bugs and they just languish mostly
Such as?
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/884210
that's a typical example. Nothing happens
Kernel bug, has to be fixed by the upsteam kernel developers.
right.. so that's mostly the reaction I get... someone upstream ought to fix it and then nothing
And you have to install one of the packages in: $ apt-file search biblatex.sty
So forward it upsteam!
sure but this was my point
Anyway, you probably want to install: texlive-bibtex-extra.
